idea: Stories about humanity doing unexpectedly moral things in response to alien cruelty
targetAudienceCharacteristics: Older Americans (39-59) who value clear moral distinctions
Enjoys science fiction with traditional heroic narratives
Values competence, duty, and getting things done over debate
Appreciates 'Greatest Generation' style sacrifice and unity
Responds to stories about protecting the vulnerable, especially children
Values keeping promises and honoring commitments across generations
Enjoys working-class heroes and practical problem-solving
Prefers action over words, results over press conferences

40,000 War Refugees Expected Camps—We Gave Them Citizenship in 48 Hours Instead
The Galaxy Said '2 Years Minimum'—Humanity Had It Done by Tuesday
They Needed 500 Engineers—We Sent 5,000 Volunteers in 48 Hours

No Medals, No Parades—Just a Job That Needed Doing
The Galaxy Talked About Helping—Humanity Was Already There
They Saved One Human Colony 30 Years Ago—We Saved Their Entire Species Yesterday
A Handshake Made in 1995—An Alliance Honored in 2157
They Stood With Earth When No One Else Would—We Never Forgot
The Evacuation Plan Was 47 Pages—Our Plan Was One Sentence: 'Get Everyone Out'
They Brought Protocols—We Brought Bolt Cutters

Command Wanted a Committee—The Captain Wanted Results

The Manual Said Impossible—Experience Said Otherwise
By-the-Book Would've Taken Weeks—We Had Hours
